metadata.dc:author: Canales García, R A
Ayala Gaytán, J J
Camacho Mezquita, B G
Rico Bazaldúa, G
González Villarreal, M G
metadata.dc:description: In 1986 we detected serum antibodies against HIV in twenty four patients of our group of 84 cases of moderate to severe hemophilics. Twenty were asymptomatic to the acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). After seven years, only three (15%) remain asymptomatic and seventeen (85%) developed AIDS. The mean time of development of AIDS was 56 months. Of these patients, fourteen (70%) have died. The median survival between the onset of the disease and death was eleven months. Only four of the patients that died received zidovudin, and in them we observed a median survival of 32 months.
metadata.dc:title: Seguimiento de siete años de 20 pacientes hemofílicos infectados con VIH.
[20-year follow-up of hemophiliac patients infected with HIV].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista de investigacion clinica; organo del Hospital de Enfermedades de la Nutricion
